results.title: Edward scissorhands [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Denise Di Novi and Tim Burton
results.brief_description: A lonely old inventor in a castle upon a hill dies and leaves his greatest creation, a boy called Edward, unfinished. Instead of hands, the boy has sharp shears of metal. Until his rescue by a kindly Avon lady who takes him home to the pastel paradise of suburbia, Edward lives alone in darkness. “Edward Scissorhands” is more than a fairy tale by masterful director Tim Burton. This is a satire/allegory which is both funny and moving. Johnny Depp as Edward is a gentle creature full of pathos, yet dignified; much less a monster than the fickle humans who at first embrace him and then seek to destroy him. Dianne Weist stars as Avon Lady Peg, and Winona Ryder as her daughter, Kim. The sets are typical of Burton’s famed surreal style. “Edward Scissorhands” is a film of great poignancy with its own special beauty.

results.title: Edward Said (Writers in Conversation)
results.brief_description: Edward Said, through much of his work, is concerned with the identity of the Palestinians, a dispersed and dispossessed people attempting to come to terms with exile. In this interview with Salman Rushdie, Edward Said explains the history and evolution of the Palestinian people.

results.title: Edward John Eyre
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit, Bern Gandy and Bill Mason
results.brief_description: This film covers the route which Edward John Eyre explored in 1840 between Adelaide, South Australia, and Albany, Western Australia. Illustrates scenes along this route which skirts the Nullabor Plain and is now known as the Eyre Highway; Adelaide as it was when he left is reproduced from old drawings and contrasted with the Adelaide of today; Whyalla with its shipbuilding and iron industry; Eucla, deserted gold mining town, Coolgardie and Kalgoorlie; present-day Perth, now a big city.

results.title: Edvard Munch
results.creator_credit: Norsk Rikskringkasting, Sveriges Radio and Peter Watkins
results.brief_description: Watkin’s portrayal of the life and work of the pioneer Norwegian expressionist painter and graphic artist Edvard Munch (1863-1908), combines quasi-documentary and period drama, incorporating meticulous detail to place the artist in a social and historical context. The use of non-professional actors, often communicating directly with the audience by glances into the camera, adds to the immediacy of the dialogue which was written in collaboration with the cast. The resulting film takes the viewer to the heart of the artistic temperament and to the very core of the creative process. In Norwegian and German dialogue with English narration and subtitles. Cast includes Geir Westby and Gro Fraas.

results.title: Educational smorgasbord (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Educational smorgasbord operates in northern NSW and is organised by an ex-primary headmaster. Examines issues in community education - participation, funding, accountability.

results.title: Education?
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Malcolm Otton and Chris Noonan
results.brief_description: The possible future choices for education, ranging from the free schools approach to the use of technology as a teaching supplement are examined. This film is not an in-depth analysis of these issues, but rather is a discussion-raiser for teacher or parent groups looking at issues of alternatives in education

results.title: Education: where do we go from here?
results.creator_credit: Rowe and Co Communications and Ron Rowe
results.brief_description: A wide variety of education academics, administrators politicians and teacher-union leaders talk about the increasing irrelevance of education systems. Those interviewed include Barry Jones, Dr. Lawrie Shears, Dr. Ken Mckinnon and Professor Headley Beare.
